column1: '''''The Tolkien Diary 2002''''' was a blank diary book featuring illustrations by [[Ted Nasmith]].

column2:
The annual Tolkien diary, this year containing all-new artwork depicting scenes based on the first book of J.R.R. Tolkien’s The Lord of the Rings.

This sumptuous week-to-view desk diary features 13 brand new paintings from Ted Nasmith, acclaimed Tolkien jacket artist and creator of the illustrated Silmarillion. The paintings are all based on the first volume of Tolkien’s classic masterpiece, The Lord of the Rings, and coincides with the release of the movie from New Line Cinema, guaranteeing greater popularity than ever before.}}
